items.headline: U.S. Equities Show Mixed Performance Today Amid Tech Rebound and Economic Data Anticipation
items.summary: U.S. stock markets are exhibiting mixed performance in late-morning trading, following a two-day winning streak that saw major indices close higher on Monday. While the Dow Jones Industrial Average continued its ascent, the Nasdaq Composite saw a slight decline. Investor sentiment remains constructive despite lingering geopolitical tensions and anticipation of key economic data releases later this week, including the consumer price index and jobs report. Tech stocks are once again in focus, with a rebound seen in some names after last week's AI-driven sell-off.

items.headline: Spotify Technology S.A. Jumps on Strong Q4 and Q1 Outlook
items.summary: Shares of Spotify surged 15% after the company delivered a strong Q4 performance and provided Q1 guidance that exceeded expectations for key metrics like total Monthly Active Users (MAUs) and premium subscribers.

items.headline: Datadog Rises on Q4 Beat and Positive Q1 Revenue Guidance
items.summary: Datadog's stock climbed 13% after the company reported a strong Q4 earnings beat and issued stronger-than-expected revenue guidance for Q1 2026. Management also highlighted continued investment in AI-powered innovation.

items.headline: Ubiquiti Surges on Robust Quarterly Results
items.summary: Ubiquiti saw its shares surge 14.47% following the release of strong quarterly results and a higher price target from Barclays.

items.headline: Becton, Dickinson Leads S&P 500 Decliners
items.summary: Becton, Dickinson and Company was among the worst-performing components of the S&P 500 index, trading down 19.0% today.

items.headline: Waters Corporation Falls on Softer Profit Despite Sales Growth
items.summary: Waters Corporation's stock fell 13.94% after its earnings report indicated softer profit margins, even with an increase in quarterly and full-year sales.

items.headline: Monday.com Plummets on Disappointing Guidance
items.summary: Shares of Monday.com Limited plummeted over 20% after the software provider issued revenue and profit guidance that failed to meet analyst expectations.

items.headline: Technology, Materials, and Communication Services Lead U.S. Sectors
items.summary: In the U.S. market, technology, materials, and communication services sectors were the biggest gainers on Monday, with the Technology Select Sector SPDR (XLK) rising 1.6%. Seven out of the 11 S&P 500 sectors closed in positive territory. Conversely, consumer staples and healthcare lagged.

items.headline: Investors Await Key Economic Data This Week
items.summary: Market participants are keenly awaiting the release of important economic data later this week, including the Consumer Price Index (CPI), Retail Sales reports, and the January non-farm payrolls report. These releases are expected to provide further clarity on inflation and the labor market.

items.headline: CVS Health Reports Strong Q4 and Full-Year 2025 Results
items.summary: CVS Health Corporation announced robust operating results for Q4 and full-year 2025. Total revenues increased by 8.2% to $105.7 billion in Q4, with full-year revenues reaching a record $402.1 billion. The company also confirmed its full-year 2026 adjusted EPS guidance.

items.headline: Fiserv Reports Mixed Q4 and Full-Year 2025 Results
items.summary: Fiserv, Inc. reported a 1% increase in GAAP revenue for Q4 2025, reaching $5.28 billion, and a 4% increase for the full year. However, adjusted EPS decreased by 21% in Q4 and 2% for the full year. The company provided 2026 guidance for organic revenue growth and adjusted EPS.

items.headline: Small Business Optimism Index Remains Above Average
items.summary: The NFIB Small Business Optimism Index dipped slightly by 0.2 points in January to 99.3 but remained above its 52-year average. Expected real sales volume saw a substantial 6-point increase, and credit markets appear more favorable for small borrowers.

items.headline: Global Macro Trends: Gold Surges, Oil Dips, Bitcoin Plunges
items.summary: In broader markets, gold surged 5%, nearing $5,000 per ounce, while WTI Crude oil fell 2.5%. Bitcoin experienced a significant plunge of 16.5%, marking its worst week since 2022. Geopolitical tensions across Iran, Ukraine, and Taiwan continue to be closely monitored by investors.
